title: Zhang Ke (architect)
text:
Zhang Ke (; born 1970) is a Chinese <a href="architect">architect</a>. Zhang Ke is a graduate of <a href="Tsinghua%20University">Tsinghua University</a> in <a href="Beijing">Beijing</a> and the <a href="Harvard%20Graduate%20School%20of%20Design">Harvard Graduate School of Design</a> at <a href="Harvard%20University">Harvard University</a> in Cambridge, Massachusetts, USA. In 2001, he founded his studio "ZAO/standardarchitecture" (标准营造).
Zhang Ke is a recipient of the 2016 <a href="Aga%20Khan%20Award%20for%20Architecture">Aga Khan Award for Architecture</a> and the 2017 <a href="Alvar%20Aalto%20Medal">Alvar Aalto Medal</a>. In 2016, he represented China at the <a href="Venice%20Biennale">Venice Biennale</a>.
